DataElement.preferredDefinition: The direction and/or type of DNA fragment strand(s) used in analysis by high-throughput sequencing.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A collection of double stranded DNA fragments flanked by oligonucleotide sequence adapters to enable their analysis by high-throughput sequencing._Indicates the direction and/or type of the SeqFeature, i.e. whether it is in the 5' or 3' direction, is double stranded, etc. (caMAGE)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A collection of double stranded DNA fragments flanked by oligonucleotide sequence adapters to enable their analysis by high-throughput sequencing.

Concepts.definition: A collection of double stranded DNA fragments flanked by oligonucleotide sequence adapters to enable their analysis by high-throughput sequencing.

Property.preferredDefinition: Indicates the direction and/or type of the SeqFeature, i.e. whether it is in the 5' or 3' direction, is double stranded, etc.

Concepts.definition: Indicates the direction and/or type of the SeqFeature, i.e. whether it is in the 5' or 3' direction, is double stranded, etc. (caMAGE)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A protein or RNA whose structure is represented in and determined by genomic sequences.

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/21/20 jk per SME, moved DEC from Library CSI to MCL Genomics Core CSI. 11/19/18 jk Released per PI/Maureen at Oct 2018 Steering Comm meeting.   5/11/18 jk created for MCL Genomics based on Sequence Read Archive (SRA) data element.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicates the direction and/or type of the SeqFeature, i.e. whether it is in the 5' or 3' direction, is double stranded, etc. (caMAGE)_Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Non-directional sequencing, where the reads can map from either the transcript strand or its complement.

Concepts.definition: Non-directional sequencing, where the reads can map from either the transcript strand or its complement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.15 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002731. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Directional sequencing, where the first read (or the only read in case of single end reads) is from the complement strand.

Concepts.definition: Directional sequencing, where the first read (or the only read in case of single end reads) is from the complement strand.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Directional sequencing, where the first read of the read pair (or in case of single end reads, the only read) is from the transcript strand.

Concepts.definition: Directional sequencing, where the first read of the read pair (or in case of single end reads, the only read) is from the transcript strand.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A protein or RNA whose structure is represented in and determined by genomic sequences.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Indicates the direction and/or type of the SeqFeature, i.e. whether it is in the 5' or 3' direction, is double stranded, etc. (caMAGE):Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Indicates the direction and/or type of the SeqFeature, i.e. whether it is in the 5' or 3' direction, is double stranded, etc. (caMAGE)
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
